text.__SUMMARY__: Gerrhopilus tindalli, also known as the Nilgiri Hills worm snake or Tindall's worm snake, is a harmless blind snake species found in southern India. No subspecies are currently recognized.
text.Etymology: The specific name, tindalli, is in honor of Roger Tindall.
text.Geographic range: It is found in India in the Nilgiri Hills, Malabar District. The type locality given is "Nilambur, Malabar district" [India].
